title: Consumers with a newspaper or magazine subscriptions in the U.S. 2017 , by age group
summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The maximum Share of respondents 54.0 is found at Response Retirees and the minimum is found at Millennials where Response is 33.0.
The highest value at Response Retirees is 1.64x times more than the lowest value at Millennials.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
Response Retirees has the highest Share of respondents and Millennials has the lowest Share of respondents.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The maximum Share of respondents 54.0 is found at Response Retirees and the minimum is found at Millennials where Response is 33.0.
The highest value at Response Retirees is 1.64x times more than the lowest value at Millennials.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Response in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The Share of respondents is highest at Response Retirees and lowest at Response Millennials.
Second maximum Share of respondents is found at Response Boomers.
The difference of Share of respondents between the highest and lowest Response is 21.0.
The Response Retirees has the highest Share of respondents, followed by Boomers, and Total. Down to the Response Millennials which is the lowest.
The highest value 54.0 at Retirees is almost 1.3 times larger than the average value 41.6.
Summing up the values of all Responses, we get total 208.0.
